intro: Sericographis acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed sericographis, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Sericographis acuminata is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions.
